result.reason: Tab title shows saved credentials instead of actual connected credentials when using 'Connect without credentials' option
result.approach: When NoCredentials force flag is used, the cloned ConnectionInfo has empty username/domain. The tab title at line 591-604 of ConnectionWindow.cs reads from connectionInfo which has blank credentials, showing empty parens. The fix should either: (1) not show logon info on tab when NoCredentials was used (since actual credentials are entered in RDP native dialog and not available to mRemoteNG), or (2) update the tab title after the RDP session authenticates, if the protocol exposes the connected username. Option 1 is simpler and more correct — skip the ShowLogonInfoOnTabs block when the connection was opened with Force.NoCredentials.

attempts.raw_output:
Now I have a clear understanding of the issue. When "Connect without credentials" is used, the `ConnectionInitiator` clones the connection and clears username/domain/password (lines 108-122). However, the tab title is built from `connectionInfo.Username` and `connectionInfo.Domain` at lines 591-604 of `ConnectionWindow.cs`. Since the clone has empty credentials, the tab shows `()` — but the actual credentials entered by the user in the RDP logon dialog are never captured back to update the tab title. The stored/saved credentials still appear because the tab title is set at connection creation time using the original connection's properties.

The key file is `ConnectionWindow.cs` where the tab text is built, and potentially the protocol classes (like `RdpProtocol.cs`) which could provide the actual connected credentials.
